decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures and using cards like Faithless Looting and Goblin Lore to discard and draw cards, enabling casting free Hollow Ones and Flamewake Phoenixes. The aggressive nature of the deck is highlighted by fast starts with Flameblade Adepts and Bloodghasts, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality to clear the way for attacks. Tasigur and Gurmag Angler provide larger threats and additional graveyard interactions to overpower opponents in a fast-paced and explosive manner.

The main idea of this Modern Aggro - Hardened Scales deck is to utilize cards like Hardened Scales, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager to quickly build up +1/+1 counters on creatures and generate strong board presence. By combining modular creatures with powerful synergy cards like Mox Opal and Animation Module, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient plays. The inclusion of utility cards like Throne of Geth and Evolutionary Leap provide additional options for manipulating the board and ensuring a steady stream of threats.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with Human creatures, utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up the team. With disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck aims to control the opponent's resources while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Mantis Rider. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and generate tempo advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and disruptive aggro strategy centered around Human creatures.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering and removing opponent's threats, while also generating card advantage through card draw and selection. It aims to stall the game with board wipes like Terminus and Supreme Verdict, while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to generate incremental advantage and ultimately win the game. The deck also includes land disruption with spells like Ghost Quarter and Field of Ruin to disrupt opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, removing threats, and bouncing or flipping opponent's creatures. It utilizes a combination of card draw, counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Thing in the Ice to disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure victory. The inclusion of cards like Cryptic Command, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Blood Moon adds versatility and additional disruption to control the pace of the game. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through intelligent decision-making and efficient use of resources.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of powerful spells and planeswalkers to control the game, drawing out the opponent's threats and removing them efficiently. With cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, alongside counterspells like Cryptic Command and Logic Knot, the deck aims to maintain control of the board while generating card advantage. The deck also includes removal in Lightning Helix and Path to Exile, alongside versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage for additional utility. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck revolves around controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to slow down the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while also utilizing Search for Azcanta to filter through the deck for key cards. Creatures like Monastery Mentor and Snapcaster Mage provide additional threats and value. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility with various fetch lands and dual lands.

The main idea behind this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible using efficient burn spells and fast creatures. By utilizing a combination of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike along with powerful creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. With a focus on speed and efficiency, this aggro deck aims to close out the game swiftly and decisively.

The main concept of this Spirit Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive creature strategy. Utilizing cards like Supreme Phantom and Drogskol Captain to boost the power of your Spirit creatures, alongside disruptive cards like Spell Queller and Selfless Spirit to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also incorporates a strong mana base with Noble Hierarch and various fetchlands to ensure consistent and efficient mana production. Additionally, the inclusion of Aether Vial and Collected Company allows for explosive plays and flexibility in combat situations.

The deck focuses on applying strong and consistent pressure on the opponent by deploying efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, backed up by disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also features powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to control the board. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the color requirements of the spells in the deck, ensuring smooth gameplay and consistent performance. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their game plan while dealing significant damage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful threats like Karn, Scion of Urza and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The key strategy is to assemble UrzaTron (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana and play threats ahead of curve. Cards like Expedition Map and Treasure Mage help find key pieces of the Tron lands or threats, while cards like Mindslaver and Academy Ruins provide additional control options. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents with powerful threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on playing efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, backed up by disruption in the form of cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. It also runs powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to control the board and generate card advantage. With a variety of removal spells like Terminate and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to maintain aggression while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The efficient mana base allows for consistent casting of spells while also supporting the powerful land creature, Raging Ravine.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, in order to bring back powerful creatures like Vengevine and Gravecrawler. By sacrificing creatures and triggering cards like Bridge from Below, the deck can create a swarm of tokens and overwhelm the opponent. The combo aspect comes from using cards like Greater Gargadon and Goblin Bushwhacker to deliver a finishing blow in a single turn, utilizing the graveyard as a resource to achieve victory.

The main concept of this Aggro - Humans deck is to quickly fill the board with powerful Human creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage. The deck also takes advantage of Aether Vial to cheat creatures onto the battlefield at instant speed and uses cards like Noble Hierarch to accelerate its mana base. The synergy between Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish allows the deck to quickly grow its creatures and overwhelm the opponent with threats.

This Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler, combined with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Nahiri, the Harbinger to provide additional utility and removal spells like Dreadbore and Fatal Push to deal with threats. Lingering Souls provides a constant source of tokens to apply pressure. The deck's mana base includes a mix of red, black, and white sources to ensure consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive Human creatures and disrupting the opponent with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. By utilizing Aether Vial and creatures like Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy. The mana base is tailored to support the diverse Human creature types with lands like Cavern of Souls and Ancient Ziggurat. Overall, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game through disruptive interaction and efficient creatures.
